Not included are Grants-in-Aid from the Educational Television and Radio CenÂ¬
ter to NAEB member-stations for radio program upgrading since from 1954 on
these were handled directly from the Center with the stations; however, the
NAEB handled publicizing, selection and recommendation, and distribution.
This has so far amounted to $42,000.00 per year ($126,000.00).
During this same period, increasing contributions from member stations were
levied for dues, radio network fees, and other materials distributed, as the
